general: This act helps courts deal with legal cases that involve people or businesses from different countries. It makes sure that these cases are handled consistently across all countries involved, using rules set out in international agreements like the Hague Conventions. This will make it easier for judges to decide these cases and ensure that everyone gets a fair trial.

series.text:
* Simplified point 1: This act implements international agreements related to private international law, including the 1996 Hague Convention, the 2005 Hague Convention, and the 2007 Hague Convention.
* Simplified point 2: The act gives these conventions the force of law in the UK and allows for their implementation through regulations made by the appropriate national authority.
* Simplified point 3: Regulations can be made to apply the conventions with or without modifications, and can also provide for the sharing of information and legal aid.
* Simplified point 4: The act applies to England and Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland, and can be extended to the Isle of Man with an Order in Council.
* Simplified point 5: The act comes into force on IP completion day, except for certain sections that come into force on the day it is passed.

summary:
The Private International Law (Implementation of Agreements) Act 2020 helps make sure that laws from other countries work well in the UK. It does this by implementing international agreements about private international law, like the Hague Conventions from 1996, 2005, and 2007. These agreements help sort out things like divorce, child custody, and inheritance when people move around and have connections to different countries.

This act makes these agreements into UK law so they can be used in courts here. It also lets the government make rules to put the agreements into practice and share information between countries. The act covers all of the UK - England, Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland - and can even be used in the Isle of Man if the government there wants to use it too.

The act will start working on "IP completion day," which means when everything else is ready. But some parts might start working right away, like the part that lets the government make rules. So, this act will help make sure that the UK's private international law works smoothly and fairly for everyone involved!
single:
* Implements the Hague Conventions of 1996, 2005, and 2007 related to parental responsibility and measures for the protection of children.
* Provides for the implementation of other international agreements on private international law.
* Allows the appropriate national authority to make regulations for the purpose of implementing international agreements and applying them to private international law.
* Extends to England and Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland.
* Comes into force on IP completion day or the day it is passed.
* May be cited as the Private International Law (Implementation of Agreements) Act 2020.
